message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper is primarily focused on computer vision and robotics, specifically on the problem of image-based localization. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also uses learning-based methods, such as Random Forests and Convolutional Neural Networks, which are commonly used in machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. The use of data augmentation techniques to generate more training data suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.GR (Graphics). Finally, the paper's focus on camera pose estimation and optimization suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.RO (Robotics).
